description:
Hydria, found in Hadra, the Eastern Necropolis of Alexandria. Used for burial of Greeks who died in Alexandria.
Bulbous form on low foot decorated with broad band of ivy in dark and reddish brown on buff ground on one side and around neck and circular scroll on other side with two sections of lattice work; two handles at side and one at neck; neck handle slightly imperfect
title: Hydria
